body:
Why is it that it suddenly fails today? Did you update matplotlib? Or deeplabcut?
According to this post https://github.com/nucleic/kiwi/issues/68#issuecomment-761707334, 
```
pip uninstall kiwisolver
pip install kiwisolver
```
should work.

I have other programming projects, but in theory I didn't touch the DLC virtual environment for at least half a year. I did update my MacOS, and do other stuffs in between, but I don't know if that might affect the deeplabcut lib. Do you think it might be the matplotlib lib problem?

I have tired 
pip uninstall kiwisolver
pip install kiwisolver

But didn't work.

I tried to upgrade the deeplabcut too, but it took very long, and kind of frozen when installing some dependencies.

You tried the commands within the environment, correct?
Could you share some more details about your attempt to upgrade DLC? What were the dependencies causing problems? deeplabcut should install fine with `pip install 'deeplabcut[gui]'==2.2rc2` 😊

I created a new conda env, and install with the command you provided:

Collecting deeplabcut[gui]==2.2rc2
  Using cached deeplabcut-2.2rc2-py3-none-any.whl (709 kB)

ERROR: No matching distribution found for opencv-python-headless~=3.4.9.33
It looks like you use python 3.9, whereas our conda environment files guarantee python 3.7. Please use these instead.
The new conda env I created is python 3.9
Precisely, whereas we provide deeplabcut with python 3.7. Why don't you create your new environment off the conda configuration files we provide?

For your info:

When I go back to the old env, and do the upgrade:

I have been thinking, maybe I have messed my python some time ago...should I just use the time machine to go back to the time that works???

Your environment likely contains packages other than deeplabcut; for example, this "appnope" package causing you trouble is not present in any of the environments I have.
Assuming you have downloaded the YAML files from DeepLabCut/conda-environments, you just need to run `conda env create -f DLC-CPU.yaml` and you should be set on the right track. ☺️

  packages: defaults/osx-64::intel-openmp-2021.2.0-hecd8cb5_564, defaults/osx-64::llvm-openmp-10.0.0-h28b9765_0
  path: 'lib/libiomp5.dylib'

It's finally working!!!

I outline the solution here, so that if other people have the same problem (conflict with some other lib or dependences), they can solve it quicker!

Please don't try to use time machine to move back to an earlier time...I wasted > 24 hrs frustrating with installing the MacOS.

Instead:
1. clean up the libraries in my python(s)
pip freeze | xargs pip uninstall -y

2. remove and reinstall anaconda

3. fix the pythonw (default is 2.x) to 3.x

4. install deeplabcut as in the documentation


Thank you!
